info.title: Azure AD
info.description: Azure Active Directory is an Identity and Access Management cloud solution that extends your on-premises directories to the cloud and provides single sign-on to thousands of cloud (SaaS) apps and access to web apps you run on-premises.

post.description: Create an Office 365 group in your AAD tenant.

displayName.description: Display name of the new group.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias of the new group.

securityEnabled.description: True if the new group is a security group.

mailEnabled.description: True if the new group is a mailing group.

post.description: Create a security group in your AAD tenant.

displayName.description: Display name of the new group.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias of the new group.

securityEnabled.description: True if the new group is a security group.

mailEnabled.description: True if the new group is a mailing group.

patch.description: Update the info for a user.

post.description: Invalidate all refresh tokens for a user
Get the groups a user is a member of.
Create a new user in your AAD tenant.

get.description: Get the users who are members of a group.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Limit on the number of results to return (default = all).

post.description: Add a user to a group in this AAD tenant.
If the user is a member of the given group, the result will contain the given id. Otherwise the result will be empty.

put.description: Assign a manager for a user.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.x-ms-summary: Choose columns to display (blank for all)

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description: You can use $search on the displayName and description properties. (eg $search="displayName:Web")

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Retrieves the total count of matching resources

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Retrieves related resources (including owner details by default)

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Indexes into a result set. Also used by some APIs to implement paging and can be used together with $top to manually page results.

get.description: Get the list of applications registered in AAD in this organization

id.description: The unique identifier for the application

deletedDateTime.description: The date and time the application was deleted. The DateTimeOffset type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time.

appId.description: The unique identifier for the application that is assigned to an application by Azure AD

disabledByMicrosoftStatus.description: Specifies whether Microsoft has disabled the registered application

createdDateTime.description: The date and time the application was registered. The DateTimeOffset type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time

displayName.description: The display name for the application

groupMembershipClaims.description: The groups claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the application expects

identifierUris.description: The URIs that identify the application within its Azure AD tenant, or within a verified custom domain if the application is multi-tenant

isDeviceOnlyAuthSupported.description: Specifies whether this application supports device authentication without a user. The default is false

isFallbackPublicClient.description: Specifies the fallback application type as public client, such as an installed application running on a mobile device. The default value is false which means the fallback application type is confidential client such as a web app

notes.description: Notes relevant for the management of the application

optionalClaims.description: Optional claims in their Azure AD applications to specify the claims that are sent to their application by the Microsoft security token service

publisherDomain.description: The verified publisher domain for the application

signInAudience.description: Specifies the Microsoft accounts that are supported for the current application. Supported values are: AzureADMyOrg, AzureADMultipleOrgs, AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount, PersonalMicrosoftAccount

tags.description: Custom strings that can be used to categorize and identify the application

tokenEncryptionKeyId.description: Specifies the keyId of a public key from the keyCredentials collection

displayName.description: The verified publisher name from the app publisher's Partner Center account

verifiedPublisherId.description: The ID of the verified publisher from the app publisher's Partner Center account

addedDateTime.description: The timestamp when the verified publisher was first added or most recently updated

verifiedPublisher.description: Specifies the verified publisher of the application

addIns.description: Defines custom behavior that a consuming service can use to call an app in specific contexts

acceptMappedClaims.description: When true, allows an application to use claims mapping without specifying a custom signing key

knownClientApplications.description: Used for bundling consent if you have a solution that contains two parts: a client app and a custom web API app

requestedAccessTokenVersion.description: Specifies the access token version expected by this resource. This changes the version and format of the JWT produced independent of the endpoint or client used to request the access token

adminConsentDescription.description: A description of the delegated permissions, intended to be read by an administrator granting the permission on behalf of all users

adminConsentDisplayName.description: The permission's title, intended to be read by an administrator granting the permission on behalf of all users

id.description: Unique delegated permission identifier inside the collection of delegated permissions defined for a resource application

isEnabled.description: When creating or updating a permission, this property must be set to true (which is the default). To delete a permission, this property must first be set to false

type.description: Specifies whether this delegated permission should be considered safe for non-admin users to consent to on behalf of themselves, or whether an administrator should be required for consent to the permissions

userConsentDescription.description: A description of the delegated permissions, intended to be read by a user granting the permission on their own behalf

userConsentDisplayName.description: A title for the permission, intended to be read by a user granting the permission on their own behalf

value.description: Specifies the value to include in the scp (scope) claim in access tokens

oauth2PermissionScopes.description: The definition of the delegated permissions exposed by the web API represented by this application registration

preAuthorizedApplications.description: Lists the client applications that are pre-authorized with the specified delegated permissions to access this application's APIs

api.description: Specifies settings for an application that implements a web API

appRoles.description: The collection of roles assigned to the application

logoUrl.description: CDN URL to the application's logo

marketingUrl.description: Link to the application's marketing page

privacyStatementUrl.description: Link to the application's privacy statement

supportUrl.description: Link to the application's support page

termsOfServiceUrl.description: Link to the application's terms of service statement

info.description: Basic profile information of the application such as app's marketing, support, terms of service and privacy statement URLs

keyCredentials.description: The collection of key credentials associated with the application

countriesBlockedForMinors.description: Specifies the two-letter ISO country codes

legalAgeGroupRule.description: Specifies the legal age group rule that applies to users of the app

parentalControlSettings.description: Specifies parental control settings for an application

endDateTime.description: The date and time at which the password expires represented using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time

hint.description: Contains the first three characters of the password

keyId.description: The unique identifier for the password

startDateTime.description: The date and time at which the password becomes valid. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time

passwordCredentials.description: The collection of password credentials associated with the application

redirectUris.description: Specifies the URLs where user tokens are sent for sign-in, or the redirect URIs where OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent

publicClient.description: Specifies settings for installed clients such as desktop or mobile devices

resourceAppId.description: The unique identifier for the resource that the application requires access to

id.description: The unique identifier for one of the oauth2PermissionScopes or appRole instances that the resource application exposes

type.description: Specifies whether the id property references an oauth2PermissionScopes or an appRole

resourceAccess.description: The list of OAuth2.0 permission scopes and app roles that the application requires from the specified resource

requiredResourceAccess.description: Specifies the resources that the application needs to access. This property also specifies the set of OAuth permission scopes and application roles that it needs for each of those resources

homePageUrl.description: Home page or landing page of the application

logoutUrl.description: Specifies the URL that will be used by Microsoft's authorization service to logout an user using front-channel, back-channel or SAML logout protocols

redirectUris.description: Specifies the URLs where user tokens are sent for sign-in, or the redirect URIs where OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent

enableAccessTokenIssuance.description: Specifies whether this web application can request an ID token using the OAuth 2.0 implicit flow

enableIdTokenIssuance.description: Specifies whether this web application can request an access token using the OAuth 2.0 implicit flow

implicitGrantSettings.description: Specifies whether this web application can request tokens using the OAuth 2.0 implicit flow

web.description: Specifies settings for a web application

redirectUris.description: Specifies the URLs where user tokens are sent for sign-in, or the redirect URIs where OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent

spa.description: Specifies settings for a single-page application, including sign out URLs and redirect URIs for authorization codes and access tokens

value.description: Represents an application. Any application that outsources authentication to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) must be registered in a directory

id.description: The unique identifier for the group.

description.description: An optional description for the group.

displayName.description: The display name for the group.

mail.description: The SMTP address for the group.

mailEnabled.description: True if the group is mail-enabled.

onPremisesLastSyncDateTime.description: A date-time indicating the last time at which the group was synced with the on-premises directory.
onPremisesLastSyncDateTime.x-ms-summary: On Premises Last Sync Date Time

onPremisesSyncEnabled.description: True if this group is synced from an on-premises directory.

securityEnabled.description: True if the group is a security group.

visibility.description: Visibility of the group (public or private).

id.description: A unique identifer for the user.

items.description: Business phone number for the new user.

displayName.description: The name displayed in the address book for the user.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of the user.

mail.description: The SMTP address for the user.

mobilePhone.description: The primary cellular telephone number for the user.

officeLocation.description: The office location in the user's place of business.

preferredLanguage.description: The preferred language for the user. Should follow ISO 639-1 Code; for example 'en-US'.

surname.description: The user's surname (family name or last name).

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name (UPN) of the user.
The user principal name (UPN) of the user.

displayName.description: The name displayed in the address book for the user.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias for the user.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of the user.

surname.description: The user's surname (family name or last name).

accountEnabled.description: True if the new account should be enabled.

department.description: The name for the department in which the user works.

mobilePhone.description: The mobile phone number for the user in any format such as '1 (234) 567-8910'.

officeLocation.description: The office location in the user's place of business.

preferredLanguage.description: The preferred language for the user. Should follow ISO 639-1 Code; for example 'en-US'.

items.description: Business phone number for the new user in any format such as '1 (234) 567-8910'.

customProperties.description: Free form property name and value for this user.

securityEnabledOnly.description: Determines if only security enabled groups should be fetched.

items.description: An id of a group the user is a member of.

accountEnabled.description: True if the new account should be enabled when it is created.

displayName.description: The name displayed in the address book for the user.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias for the user.

password.description: The password for the user. The user will be required to change the password on the next login.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name (UPN) of the user.

surname.description: The user's surname (family name or last name).

items.description: Business phone number for the new user in any format such as '1 (234) 567-8910'.

department.description: The name for the department in which the user works.

mobilePhone.description: The mobile phone number for the user in any format such as '1 (234) 567-8910'.

officeLocation.description: The office location in the user's place of business.

preferredLanguage.description: The preferred language for the user. Should follow ISO 639-1 Code; for example 'en-US'.

@odata.nextLink.description: Link to get next page of results

value.description: Array of users that are members of the group.

id__in_path_2.name: id
id__in_path_2.description: Unique identifier of a user (Ex. 'user@tennant.onmicrosoft.com' or '5f6ce5c7-b521-4842-9bbe-3f6d5aa5e35b').
